Package scheduling.schedulingapplication.Controller

Class UpdateCustomerController

java.lang.Object
scheduling.schedulingapplication.Controller.UpdateCustomerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class UpdateCustomerController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class creates a Controller for the UpdateCustomer form.

  • Method Details

    • passCustomer

      public static void passCustomer(Customer customer)
      This method is a static method used to pass a customer from MainController. The method assigns the static targetCustomer with the customer passed into the method.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer to be passed into UpdateCustomerController from MainController.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This is the override initialize method that executes when the UpdateCustomer form is initialized. The method populates the form with the values from the targetCustomer passed from MainController, as well as populating the customerCountry ComboBox with the countries static list. The method uses two lambdas to set the customerCountry ComboBox action event to populate the customerDivision ComboBox based on input, and set the cancelButton action event to direct to the Main form. These lambdas remove the need to use Controller Class methods to handle the relevant action events, uncluttering code and improving readability.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • onConfirm

      public void onConfirm(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the method that handles the actionEvent for the Confirm Button. It validates form inputs to ensure they are not empty. If inputs are valid, the method grabs inputs from the form (converting the selected division to a division ID using a Helper method), updates the customer in the database, and updates customer object's and data. The method then directs back to the Main form.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
